intro: Stachytarpheta chamissonis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its smaller, more delicate foliage compared to the typical form of Stachytarpheta chamissonis.
